verses.kjv: From whence come wars and fightings among you? come they not hence, even of your lusts that war in your members?
verses.web: Where do wars and fightings among you come from? Don’t they come from your pleasures that war in your members?
verses.ct: What causes all the fights and quarrels among you? They come from the selfish desires battling inside you.

verses.kjv: Ye lust, and have not: ye kill, and desire to have, and cannot obtain: ye fight and war, yet ye have not, because ye ask not.
verses.web: You lust, and don’t have. You murder and covet, and can’t obtain. You fight and make war. You don’t have, because you don’t ask.
verses.ct: You want things but don't get them. You're willing to kill and you burn with envy, yet you still can't have what you want. You fight and wage war against each other, but you don't have what you need because you never ask God for it.

verses.kjv: Ye ask, and receive not, because ye ask amiss, that ye may consume it upon your lusts.
verses.web: You ask, and don’t receive, because you ask with wrong motives, so that you may spend it on your pleasures.
verses.ct: And when you do ask, you don't receive anything because your motives are wrong — you just want to spend it on your own pleasures.

verses.kjv: Ye adulterers and adulteresses, know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God? whosoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.
verses.web: You adulterers and adulteresses, don’t you know that friendship with the world is hostility toward God? Whoever therefore wants to be a friend of the world makes himself an enemy of God.
verses.ct: You unfaithful people! Don't you realize that friendship with the world means hostility toward God? Anyone who chooses to be a friend of the world becomes an enemy of God.

verses.kjv: Do ye think that the scripture saith in vain, The spirit that dwelleth in us lusteth to envy?
verses.web: Or do you think that the Scripture says in vain, “The Spirit who lives in us yearns jealously”?
verses.ct: Do you think Scripture says without reason that the spirit God placed in us is filled with intense longing?

verses.kjv: But he giveth more grace. Wherefore he saith, God resisteth the proud, but giveth grace unto the humble.
verses.web: But he gives more grace. Therefore it says, “God resists the proud, but gives grace to the humble.”
verses.ct: But God gives even greater grace. That's why Scripture says, "God opposes the proud but gives grace to the humble."

verses.kjv: Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
verses.web: Be subject therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
verses.ct: So submit yourselves to God. Stand against the devil, and he will run from you.

verses.kjv: Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you. Cleanse your hands, ye sinners; and purify your hearts, ye double minded.
verses.web: Draw near to God, and he will draw near to you. Cleanse your hands, you sinners. Purify your hearts, you double-minded.
verses.ct: Come close to God, and he will come close to you. Wash your hands clean, you sinners. Purify your hearts, you who are torn between loyalties.

verses.kjv: Be afflicted, and mourn, and weep: let your laughter be turned to mourning, and your joy to heaviness.
verses.web: Lament, mourn, and weep. Let your laughter be turned to mourning, and your joy to gloom.
verses.ct: Grieve over your sin, mourn, and weep. Let your laughter turn to mourning and your joy turn to sorrow.

verses.kjv: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he shall lift you up.
verses.web: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he will exalt you.
verses.ct: Humble yourselves before the Lord, and he will lift you up.

verses.kjv: Speak not evil one of another, brethren. He that speaketh evil of his brother, and judgeth his brother, speaketh evil of the law, and judgeth the law: but if thou judge the law, thou art not a doer of the law, but a judge.
verses.web: Don’t speak against one another, brothers. He who speaks against a brother and judges his brother, speaks against the law and judges the law. But if you judge the law, you are not a doer of the law, but a judge.
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, don't speak against each other. Anyone who speaks against a fellow believer or judges them is really speaking against God's law and judging it. And if you set yourself up as judge of the law, you're no longer someone who follows it — you've made yourself its judge.

verses.kjv: There is one lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy: who art thou that judgest another?
verses.web: Only one is the lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy. But who are you to judge another?
verses.ct: There is only one Lawgiver and Judge — the one who has the power to save and to destroy. So who do you think you are to judge your neighbor?

verses.kjv: Go to now, ye that say, To day or to morrow we will go into such a city, and continue there a year, and buy and sell, and get gain:
verses.web: Come now, you who say, “Today or tomorrow let’s go into this city, and spend a year there, trade, and make a profit.”
verses.ct: Listen up, you who say, "Today or tomorrow we'll travel to this city, spend a year there, do business, and make a profit."

verses.kjv: Whereas ye know not what shall be on the morrow. For what is your life? It is even a vapour, that appeareth for a little time, and then vanisheth away.
verses.web: Whereas you don’t know what your life will be like tomorrow. For what is your life? For you are a vapor that appears for a little time, and then vanishes away.
verses.ct: You don't even know what tomorrow will bring! What is your life, really? It's like a mist that appears for a brief moment and then vanishes.

verses.kjv: For that ye ought to say, If the Lord will, we shall live, and do this, or that.
verses.web: For you ought to say, “If the Lord wills, we will both live, and do this or that.”
verses.ct: Instead, you should say, "If the Lord wills it, we'll live and do this or that."

verses.kjv: But now ye rejoice in your boastings: all such rejoicing is evil.
verses.web: But now you glory in your boasting. All such boasting is evil.
verses.ct: But as it is, you brag and boast about your plans. All that kind of boasting is evil.

verses.kjv: Therefore to him that knoweth to do good, and doeth it not, to him it is sin.
verses.web: To him therefore who knows to do good, and doesn’t do it, to him it is sin.
verses.ct: So if you know the right thing to do and don't do it, that is sin.
